text: Naked Objects & Object-Oriented UI seem to communicate the idea quite well! The difference between Naked Objects and OOUI is that the former articulates direct correspondence of the UI objects and app model objects (section 8.1 from <http://downloads.nakedobjects.net/resources/Pawson%20thesis.pdf>). This probably doesn't make any difference anyway as in reality all objects are illusions in our heads. It only changes where the object illusion ends.
